intro: Farsetia orbiculata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact, bushy perennial with a short stem. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including pink, purple, white, and blue, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Farsetia orbiculata thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
